title: Can we change GA back to being a pure defensive item?
body:
for such a strong defensive item ... literally a revive but only viable for AD too? .... i just played vs a full AD team and we stacked armour but we felt punished because they all just mainly built GA and revived ....... 

GA used to be good because if you wanted to revive and stay relevent it meant sacrificng some damage but now you just get damage and a powerful revive ... whats worse is that it buiilds out of a BF which is a strong damage item as well as chain vest .... so even as you build it youre not being put down in any way and for only 2800 i find it annoying to have to deal with seeing a GA almost every game ......

I just feel so punished especially vs champs like irelia too ..... its hard enough trying to kill her through titanic/steraks and her W but when she has a GA too i  just give up .....

I believe they have GA more for ad's because mages have their defense stat item(zhonyas) and ad's have theirs(GA). Zhonyas also gives ap so why shouldn't ga have ad added as well? Maybe it is a little much but still think it is a more balanced way of having the game.

They changed it because in Pro-Play people would just buy GA's, so you'd very frequently just see 5+ GA's a game. The issue though is that Zhonya's requires the player to physically press a button to use it. GA reads exactly this "Upon taking lethal damage enter stasis for 4 seconds(twice the time Zhonya's allows.) after that time restore 50% of base HP and 30% of base Mana." No matter how low you were before GA popped, you'll end up at 50% so you get to heal, and avoid all damage for 4 seconds.

Meanwhile Zhonya's costs 100 more, only allows for 2.5 seconds of stasis, and requires you to make the decision to use it(this one is a HUGE deal.). Having to make the decision to use something is GIGANTIC because with GA if an assassin tries to kill you, you dont have to react at all, even if the assassin played it perfectly, you revive for free. With Zhonya's you have to press the button before they deal their damage or you die, there's skill, GA requires 0 skill but was pigeon holled to only allow AD's to buy it despite the fact that AD's have this many defensive items.

{{item:3155}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3139}} {{item:3814}} {{item:3812}} {{item:3046}} 

Death's Dance transfer's all damage you take into 15% DOT, which means you get tankier to Burst. Phantom dancer gives 12% resistance to all damage taken from whatever your attacking. AD's had plenty of defensive items, ADC's can and have built all of these items(steraks wasn't always a melee only item.) 

Ap's have these.

{{item:3157}} {{item:3102}}

{{item:3040}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3027}} dont forget about these ones. health is also considered defense

You have the option to pop zhonyas or save it, and even if you had popped zhonyas to survive a few more seconds, you will still have zhonyas by next team fight anyways With GA you dont have that option, not only do you die you also lose a 5 min cd item.
Hp is useless against lethality.
Lethality is designed to kill mages. Why should mages be able to fight assassins, assassins are their counter.

Lethality is designed to kill squishes, it's best use is against champs that don't build Armor or build very little. This includes Ap/Ad Carries, Assassins(most of them atleast), BURST MAGES and Enchanter's. 

The issue with the items you listed is for 1, seraphs, rylai's, rod and Liandries aren't good on Burst Mages. Rod takes to long to get to it's spike, burst mages scale best into mid game, seraphs takes to long to stack when burst mages have high cooldowns and high mana costs, liandries is built to work against tanks but a burst mage isn't gonna be doing anything to a tank anyway and Rylai's was nerfed and since then is pretty useless on pretty much every mage except Swain.

Swain, Vlad, Galio and Rumble are "Battle Mages" they have short cooldowns, low mana costs and deal less damage.
Syndra, Lux, Ahri and Zoe are "Burst Mages" they have longer cooldown's, higher mana costs and deal a lot of damage, they don't scale well with resistances or health. 
Ryze, Cassiopeia, Azir and Xerath are "Artillery Mage's"  they have mid range cooldowns, high early mana costs but get a lot of mana later on and deal consistent DPS making them "AP Carries." they scale better with Health and Resistances than burst mages but not as well as Battle Mages.

Each one builds different based on the type, the issue though is mainly for Battle Mages and AP Carries, you can build as much HP as you want but with no resistances an ADC can burst you in an auto attack as either of them. The only saving grace for Burst Mages is that you can kill them before they kill you. Not to mention as all of them against an AD matchup you lose the early game because of Hexdrinker, free AP damage shield with MR tacked on?
